channel.title: Posts on ME, AI, the worl wide web and MY learnings!

item.description: Installing YOURLS on Kubernetes This guide walks through the process of deploying YOURLS (Your Own URL Shortener) on a Kubernetes cluster using Helm. Prerequisites A working Kubernetes cluster Helm installed on your machine Basic knowledge of Kubernetes concepts A domain name pointed to your cluster’s ingress controller (we’ll use go.example.com in this guide) Installation Steps 1. Create a Namespace for YOURLS First, create a dedicated namespace for YOURLS: kubectl create namespace yourls 2.
